column4: hi guys, i've just installed ubuntu as a dual boot with winxp, transferred my files across from the windows to the linux partition, and then to free up space i wanted to shrink my windows partition, which i did, but qtparted won't let me expand the linux partition to fill the space, leaving a big useless gap on my hard disk. any ideas?
you can't expand the beginning of an ext[23]  partition backward
if you want to do that, you need to use Partition Magic
